website_summaries.verdict: While this boot is good-looking, it's best suited for light use, and it may not provide optimal comfort for all wearers.
pros: Features a side zipper - a popular feature in tactical footwear
Soles resist slipping and flex to accommodate natural foot movements
cons: Laces and zippers have been known to break with typical wear
Top lace grommets have been known to cause discomfort
Some ankle pain after wear noted

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP stitching causes leather to separate from canvas on heals
customer_reviews.text: The boot in general was fine...however the stitching in the heal of both boots where the leather and the canvas meet in the back have completely torn. Cheap stitching material I guess. This exposes the back of the heal and I can push my finger completely through to my sock which of course allows water, mud, snow and other crud to enter the boot. I usually wear out the bottom sole of this boot before it needs replacing after a few years, but after barely 3 months....GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what I was looking for in a boot. My criteria were as follows: 1. all day comfort. 2. something light 3. either slip on, or side zip These boots hit on all those points. The only draw back is the sizing is slightly large. I normally wear a size 13, and these feel just a tad big, but I think some thicker socks may do the trick. It's by far not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: RaySDF250

customer_reviews.title: Good entry boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair back in 2014. Only thing I do not like is that the tongue flap that you need to pull up feels too thin and ends up needing to be readjusted often. I guess the ones being produced today are better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am a restaurant kitchen manager and as such I am on my feet 10+ hours a day, 6 days a week ... and constantly moving very quickly. After breaking these bad boys in I have found them to be the most comfortable and supportive footwear available. They support my large build and keep me spry throughout the day. They are comfortable, slip resistant, and professional. Thus a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: thugnificent

customer_reviews.title: I bought this boot and I tried it out after ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boot and I tried it out after a week I began having pain in my left foot. I took the boot off and inspected it they were two different sizes. I could not return the boots so I don't buy boots here any more. Lesson learned...
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: I tried them on and to my disappointment the boot was to large
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 11 boot. I tried them on and to my disappointment the boot was to large. I decided to order the 10.5 since it was only a little big. I exchanged them, then decided to look at the boot again. The boot was the wrong size, it was an 11.5. The box even said it was size 11. After contacting coustomer support and getting everything corrected, they are one day shipping it to me. We shall see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Turlik

customer_reviews.title: only boots ill buy
customer_reviews.text: honestly i dont remember if my current pair is from here or from a local box store, but at about $100 and almost daily use for 3 years working 9 hour shifts 5 days a week, hiking and even some mild construction work these boots are still usable. cant say how much i love these things
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Bates. Break in was fairly ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Bates. Break in was fairly quick. My last pair of Bates lasted 2-1/2 years of 50 hour per week, high mileage, Machine shop use.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL SCHAIBLE

customer_reviews.title: order these for the side zip and someone messed up ...
customer_reviews.text: order these for the side zip and someone messed up upon opening the box that was labeled side zip and tag on boot said side zip guess what no side zipper was upset where as this is my second order for boots and first one was cancelled for rocky and now these showed up I wish I could get what I order but anyway now trying for the third time to get some books hopefully third time is a charm
customer_reviews.author: albert vanderpool

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first lasted me two years and I still have them....nothing wrong with them really except for pretty worn down tread. I just wanted to get a new fresh pair with new tread. I work for the Border Patrol and I walk in the desert alot and in rocky terrain. I love how comfortable and light these boots are. It sucks trying to run someone down wearing boots that are too heavy. These boots do just the trick being as light as they are. I would definitely recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: MK BP

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable as athletic shoes, wear out as quickly too
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 pairs of these boots. I wore them daily at work. Each pair lasted less than 2 years. Considering their light weight, comfort and price, that’s probably not too bad. I have owned many other pairs of military boots that all lasted much longer or never failed, but they were also heavier and more expensive. If you don’t need the side zipper, I would recommend the Bates DuraShocks 8" leather and nylon boot which I have also worn. They were just as light and comfortable and lasted much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: I live in SW FL so I don't wear these often. Keep them in my Jeep just in case. Put them on few days ago to crawl through the brush looking for a lost dog and the left sole just fell right off. I don't think it was ever really glued on. Went to Bates web site and found a bunch of other guys had the same problem. Filled out a complaint which has been completely ignored by Bates. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: in the summer i can unzip the sides and cool off. I can polish them up if I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 5th pair of these boots. The first 3 were before they had the model with the side zipper. I beat the heck out of all of them and they last. They are a bit hot in the summer because they dont have any vents, but I've done everything in them from trail running, landscaping, construction/demo, hiking in all seasons and all weather, daily wear, industrial settings (composite toe), and more. In the cold, they allow for enough space to wear thick socks, in the summer i can unzip the sides and cool off. I can polish them up if I am going into a nicer setting. Best boots ever.
customer_reviews.author: SeanCEyler

customer_reviews.title: Durable and affordable... Durffordable?
customer_reviews.text: Bates boots are one of the most popular boots in our law enforcement agency in Texas. The vast majority own Bates boots and love them. I have bought them for work for the last seven years and they are just great. They are just the right weight for me, good breathable material and comfortable. Each pair goes through heavy use and will last me up to a year. I try to keep them clean and shiny to keep them around as much as possible. The price is just perfect so it doesn't eat up my bank account. Thanks Bates. Number one law enforcement boot.
customer_reviews.author: Juan T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Boots!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boot! I bought them on sale at Big 5, and they are perfect! They are comfortable, decent looking, and can be shined pretty well. They are very durable; ( I have had them for 8 months) and no problems. I wore them every day for 16 hours a day, for a week at Police Explorer academy. The only trouble I have had was with the laces, but that was my fault. Would recommend for police, police explorers, search and rescue, and any other job/activity that needs tactical and durable boots.
customer_reviews.author: Witsend3010

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: As an officer, the department issued us new boots every 2 years. I’ve gone through Rockies Paraboots (which I love the most for looks, not comfort), Danners (very comfortable but looks like moonboots) and these Bates. By far the best for looks, comfort, shineability (when all other factors considered), longevity, cost, and style go to these Bates. Great shoe. You will not be let down. Love the Bates.
customer_reviews.author: R. King

customer_reviews.title: super small
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots and retuned them the same day, the reason I gave it one star because its way over rated, it should be 3 stars and nothing special, its super light and not so tough at all and super small, I bought 9.5m and thatswhat I wear, its looks like its kids size
customer_reviews.author: Frank Ceasar

customer_reviews.title: An excellent, all-around boot.
customer_reviews.text: I got my first pair senior year of high school for ROTC. They looked sharp, were comfortable, and were more than adequate for any outdoors activity I could come up with. They're sturdy, hold back moisture well, and provide great traction. After my first pair got ratty, I purchased a second. However, I still use both pairs depending on what I'm doing. PROS: Excellent traction. Solid construction Good ankle support Cost-effective Comfortable Cons: Weird tread pattern wears down quickly. Doesn't seem to want to hold a shine. Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: lolwut

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lightweight boots for hot weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair in i think 2007 and as of 2018 ill be ordering my 4th pair. I love these boots. If you want lightweight boots that can slip on and off easily and quickly, these are an excellent choice. They are very not waterproof, and I usually get upgraded insoles since the included insoles are sort of bad, but I've felt that way about more expensive boots as well. But they breathe very well especially in hot weather. Very recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jacob welch

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable, and easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a solid 2 years of paintball play, farm work, and just walking around, using as everyday shoes. These are very comfortable, and easy to put on and take off, as it has the side zipper. After about the year and a half mark, the stitching began to rip a little (I could stick my finger through heel where the leather meets the cloth) on both shoes. Finally retiring them, after an especially taxing 2 day paintball event where the soles finally started to peel off. Definitely worth it, buying another pair very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory McCourt

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost one year.
customer_reviews.text: For Patrol Officers. These lasted me almost one year before the cement began separating from the soles. The inside ankle support also began breaking down. I have read many favorable reviews with some people having them for two years with no problems. They either obtained a set during a good production run or did not expose them to daily outdoor use. Other Officers I work with have had the same problems. I cannot recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: james4b

customer_reviews.title: best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: best boots ever. didn't purchase from amazon. bought 4 $70 @ dicks. my second pair, only got them cause dog chewed top off first pair. this pair I've owned over 3 years, worn all day every day, still in perfect shape, very comfy, real leather, not the fake crap u get at Walmart. when the sole comes apart ill just use silicone clear caulk. easy fix. I honestly love them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Warranty came trough with no issues
customer_reviews.text: Had a little issue with my 6 month old boots,heel was coming apart,called customer service they guided me with form to fill out,pictures to upload,a couple of days later email came in,my boots will be replaced,got them today via fedex,very happy camper,I also own two other sets,Deltas and ultra lights.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: These boots wore great for about 2 months until the sole decided it need to separate from the shoe....so there went all that money down the drain. if your goin to use for dress situations they'd be great, but wearing everyday they seem to fall apart fairly quickly!........i will never buy another pair of these worthless things!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Pierce

customer_reviews.title: They work great.
customer_reviews.text: They are light and fit snug on my foot with good support. I tryed on Magnums and 5.11 and they just seem to be filled with too much cheap padding that looks and feels bulky,and will eventually wear out over time. Break in time was a day or two, now they are bendable/flexable and loose to where I can tighten my laces for a snug, comfortable fit. I also like how they are a tactical boot, but can also be worn as a dress boot. I reccomend going to Sears and getting the boots there, same price, then you dont have to pay for shipping and wait.
customer_reviews.author: JDP

customer_reviews.title: If you live in Boots, be comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. I took a risk on another Bates my last ones we're not so great.
customer_reviews.author: magicofpaul

customer_reviews.text: I have had my Bates boots for about 4 years and love them. I have had to have the soles repaired last year (3rd year) because I walked them out. I am a military police officer so I stand a lot of post and the outside of the boot has held up perfectly. I polish the steel toe regularly and I think it helps keep them looking good. With some TLC the Bates zipper boots will last you for years.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: The boots didn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: I had these boots for 8 months, wearing them 10 hours a day, 5 days a week. Both started to rip on top of the heels. Bates uses cheaper leather on the back. I gave it an extra star for confort. Bates products have gone downhill. They lost a future customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Eh?

customer_reviews.title: 320 lbs for a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: Size 15 wore in really good. I put a Dr. Scholz insole in it and it was heaven. Worked Target security for a year and a half. A lot of standing and fast walking. For the few high-movement apprehensions, they worked great. Would recommend. I bought these at Academy Sports for $80.
customer_reviews.author: Kenton Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: As a correction officer I wear boots 5 to 6 days a week up to 16 hours at a time. The boots are comfortable, I will give them that, but the inner lining started ripping out after a few months. The soles then started seprating, I found out this is common with these boots. Even though the cost is reasonable these boots are not worth the money since they fell apart so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H

customer_reviews.title: So we bought these a couple years ago. My ...
customer_reviews.text: So we bought these a couple years ago. My son uses them only when we go on the Quads so no more than 2 weeks in a year. Quite honestly he is in college, out of state, and didn't even take them with him. So used VERY little. This year the entire bottem came right off. The sole separated from the boot in a giant piece. You can tell the rubber sole was glued on. About to call the company.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A Russell

customer_reviews.title: They can take a beating
customer_reviews.text: I don't care what you have heard in the 1 star comments, these boots are great! They got me through PJOC and are still going strong, and they shine like a charm if you do it right. BUY THESE BOOTS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ben dixon

product_meta.title: Bates Men's Ultra-Lites 8 Inches Tactical Sport Side-Zip Boot
product_meta.description:
Bates Men's Ultra-Lites 8" Tactical Sport Side Zip Work Boot


Bates Ultra-Lites have been an invaluable asset to uniformed personnel for over 10 years. Built with quality leather, 1680 denier ballistic nylon, flexible athletic construction, and classic styling, Ultra-Lites effortlessly take you from the car to the streets. 

OTHER FEATURES INCLUDE:
 * Cushioned removable (replaceable) insole
 * Slip resistant sole
 * Side Zipper with 8” and safety toe



Founded in 1885 as a dress shoe manufacturer, today Bates Footwear is dedicated to the development and manufacturing of uniform footwear for all branches of the military and civilian police forces. In 2003, the company joined the billion-dollar footwear giant, Wolverine Worldwide, Inc. and is headquartered in Rockford, Michigan. Wolverine Worldwide, Inc. is one of the world’s leading marketers of branded casual, active lifestyle, work, outdoor sport and uniform footwear. The company’s portfolio of highly recognized brands includes: Bates, Chaco, Cushe, Hush Puppies, HYTEST, Merrell, Sebago and Wolverine. The company is also the exclusive footwear licensee of popular brands including Cat Footwear, Harley-Davidson Footwear, and Patagonia Footwear. The company’s products are carried by leading retailers in the U.S. and globally in 190 countries or territories. True to size
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately Ankle#inches from arch
High-top work shoe featuring lace-up vamp and breathable lining
